feature.name: daily_wage_calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily_wage_calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.group_title: Payroll Formula Override in Leave Policy
known_issues.title: Daily Wage Formula Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The system displays a greyed-out formula in the leave policy, indicating that the payroll configuration takes precedence. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap years by defaulting to 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate total service period and gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: System does not dynamically adjust for leap years in service period calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: The gratuity calculator lacks leap year recognition, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling service periods, particularly for partial years and leap year adjustments. The system calculates service duration differently than manual expectations, using specific methodologies for segmenting service periods and applying different daily rates based on years of service.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential product gap in handling precise gratuity calculations for employees with mixed service periods | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Amount Discrepancy in Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: System may not consistently handle February 29th in leap year calculations for service duration, causing minor differences in gratuity computation. The system calculated 912 days vs. client's manual calculation of 913 days, resulting in a slight gratuity amount variation (AED 14,691.95 vs. AED 14,708.05).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Calculation in Gratuity Computation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates one extra day in total job tenure (622 vs 623 days), which impacts gratuity calculation precision. The platform seems to add an extra day when computing working days and years of service.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation may include an additional day not manually accounted for
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential minor discrepancy in days worked computation method

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Varies by Monthly Working Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are not consistent across months when using 'working days' method
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Calculation Divisors
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation mismatches.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood that the system calculates salary proration based on the specific work week configuration. In this case, the NVK Operations work week had all 7 days configured as working days, resulting in a full 31-day working month calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When payroll is processed earlier than the departure date, the full monthly salary is displayed instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration calculation does not handle scenarios where payroll processing date differs from employee departure date
known_issues.gap_statement: Product lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a timing mismatch between the Time Off and Payroll modules, causing incorrect daily wage calculations and salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively when public holidays are added after leave request processing
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Calculation Using Non-Standard Divisor
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions calculated using 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in February Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains mathematically correct, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific leave calculation methods, potentially causing incorrect salary deductions. The system uses a global daily rate that takes precedence over individual policy settings, calculating deductions using a method different from the configured leave policy.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate is recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
limitations.impact: Requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and salary adjustments

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify the leave policy formula when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the system may not automatically update the deduction amount.

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system uses a fixed 365-day year calculation, failing to recognize leap years like 2024 with 366 days
limitations.impact: Potential undercalculation of service periods and associated benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently show amounts less than expected by small decimal points (0.1 or 0.2)
limitations.impact: Affects accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Monthly accrual policies only grant leave days at month-end, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include current month's leave balance in End of Service (EOS) calculations

limitations.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Nuanced Service Period Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Service periods are calculated with specific rules: first 5 years at 21 days per year, subsequent years at 30 days per year, with special handling for incomplete years using day-based prorating and leap year adjustments.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between manual and system calculations

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Leave Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment calculations use working days as the denominator, causing monthly variations in daily wage rates
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ month-to-month based on working days count

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies and manual configuration required to align calculations

limitations.title: Proration Calculation Based on Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculations may differ from traditional calendar day expectations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Limited Proration Calculation Logic
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling During Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions and payroll deductions when modifications or deletions occur.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to remove

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies in salary deduction when public holidays or working day configurations change

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with exact calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts can slightly exceed expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Leap Year Day Calculation for Unpaid Leave
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations for unpaid leave must use the actual number of calendar days in a month, with specific attention to February in leap years (29 days, not 31 days).
limitations.impact: Accurate daily rate and unpaid leave deduction calculations

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically calculate salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current system lacks automated prorating mechanism
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracked separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Different daily wage formulas in leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings use basic + allowances, while leave policy initially shows basic only. Payroll configuration intentionally overrides leave policy for unpaid leave.
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings first; understand that this will override leave policy formula

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Gratuity amount differs from expected calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses 365-day year instead of 366 days for leap years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculation to include 366 days for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service amounts show incorrect decimal precision
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Systematic rounding error in daily wage formula application
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Ticket was escalated to development team and resolved

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incomplete leave balance for mid-month departures
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy restricts automatic prorating of leave days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance in the system or switch to conditional accrual policy for daily leave earning

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent leave salary accrual calculations across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method in leave encashment settings
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave salary accrual calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Salary proration calculation differs from expected formula
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different daily wage divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or use consistent divisor across calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates proration based on work week configuration, which may include all days as working days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify employee's work week configuration to understand proration calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic does not account for departure date relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust salary calculation or wait for system fix

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Persistent payroll deductions remain after leave request deletion
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of synchronization between leave management and payroll deduction systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual removal of orphaned deductions may be required. Contact system administrator for backend cleanup.

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect salary deduction due to public holiday timing mismatch
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Timing difference between public holiday addition and leave request processing
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually add deduction to correct the calculated amount, though not recommended by customers

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Remarks show incorrect daily rate for February
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System defaulting to 31-day month instead of using actual calendar days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount by calculating daily rate using correct number of calendar days (29 for February in leap year)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unpaid leave deductions calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific calculation settings
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate configuration before investigating policy-level discrepancies

claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on salary configuration timing. If a new salary configuration is created after a leave request, the system may not automatically update the deduction amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a fixed 365-day year calculation, failing to recognize leap years like 2024 with 366 days

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently show amounts less than expected by small decimal points (0.1 or 0.2)

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Monthly accrual policies only grant leave days at month-end, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated

claims_to_validate.title: Nuanced Service Period Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Service periods are calculated with specific rules: first 5 years at 21 days per year, subsequent years at 30 days per year, with special handling for incomplete years using day-based prorating and leap year adjustments.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Working Days Impact on Leave Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment calculations use working days as the denominator, causing monthly variations in daily wage rates

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Based on Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Calculation Logic
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling During Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions and payroll deductions when modifications or deletions occur.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence

claims_to_validate.title: Leap Year Day Calculation for Unpaid Leave
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations for unpaid leave must use the actual number of calendar days in a month, with specific attention to February in leap years (29 days, not 31 days).
